arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onTabChange
methodtemplate.description: Callback method when the user changes tab in a tab panel or divider position in split pane

arguments.methodargument: index of tab shown before the change
the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onSolutionClose
methodtemplate.description: Callback method for when solution is closed, force boolean argument tells if this is a force (not stopable) close or not.

arguments.methodargument: if false then solution close can be stopped by returning false

methodtemplate.name: onFoundSetRecordCreate
methodtemplate.description: Record pre-create trigger When false is returned the record a record not be created in the foundset.
methodtemplate.code: // return true so that the record can be created return true

arguments.methodargument: table data source
see SQL_ACTION_TYPES constants
affected primary keys
data was cached
old value
new value
the event that triggered the action
the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onRecordDelete
methodtemplate.description: Record pre-delete trigger Validate the record to be deleted. When false is returned the record will not be deleted in the database. When an exception is thrown the record will also not be deleted in the database but it will be added to databaseManager.getFailedRecords(), the thrown exception can be retrieved via record.exception.getValue().

arguments.methodargument: record that will be deleted
the event that triggered the action
the event that triggered the action
the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onDrag
methodtemplate.description:
Handle start of a drag, it can set the data that should be transfered and should return a constant which dragndrop mode/modes is/are supported
Should return a DRAGNDROP constant or a combination of 2 constants: DRAGNDROP.MOVE if only a move can happen, DRAGNDROP.COPY if only a copy can happen, DRAGNDROP.MOVE|DRAGNDROP.COPY if a move or copy can happen, DRAGNDROP.NONE if nothing is supported (drag should not start).

arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onDragOver
methodtemplate.description:
Handle a drag over. Determines of a drop is allowed in this location.
Return true is drop is allowed, otherwise false.

arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onDrop
methodtemplate.description: Handle a drop Return true if drop has been performed successfully, otherwise false.

arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action
the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onElementFocusGained
methodtemplate.description: Handle focus gained event of an element on the form. Return false when the focus gained event of the element itself shouldn't be triggered.

arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onElementFocusLost
methodtemplate.description: Handle focus lost event of an element on the form. Return false when the focus lost event of the element itself shouldn't be triggered.

arguments.methodargument: the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onError
methodtemplate.description: Callback method for when an error occurred

arguments.methodargument: exception to handle
the event that triggered the action

methodtemplate.name: onFoundSetFind
methodtemplate.description: Foundset pre-find trigger When false is returned the foundset will not go into find mode.

methodtemplate.name: onRecordUpdate
methodtemplate.description: Record pre-update trigger Validate the record to be updated. When false is returned the record will not be updated in the database. When an exception is thrown the record will also not be updated in the database but it will be added to databaseManager.getFailedRecords(), the thrown exception can be retrieved via record.exception.getValue().
